name: unpunctuated
content:
unpunctuated adjective
(WRITING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of writing) with no punctuation marks (= symbols): The letter contains two long, unpunctuated sentences.
More examplesFewer examplesThe account was written as a sequence of unpunctuated paragraphs. I'm all too often on the receiving end of incoherent, ungrammatical, unpunctuated stream-of-consciousness thoughts.His letters were funny, misspelled and unpunctuated.

unpunctuated adjective
(TIME/ACTIVITY)
formal with no pauses or interruptions: unpunctuated by It was one of those rare British summer days unpunctuated by rain.
More examplesFewer examplesI remember waking up on Monday morning to a dark tunnel of time, unpunctuated by anything of interest. Your life has become unpunctuated, whereas the lives of other people around you have these distinct phases.
